intro: Nephrophyllum abyssinicum, commonly known as the Abyssinian nephrophyllum, is a rare and unique plant native to Ethiopia. It is a succulent shrub characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves and clusters of small, star-shaped flowers. The plant is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing drought-resistant features such as reduced leaf surface area. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, attracting pollinators like bees and moths. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
